trans-unit.source: Test Orders

seg-source.mrk: Test Orders

trans-unit.source: In the test orders, the determined actual values of a test are entered and, if available, compared with the predetermined required value. The goal of the test order is to determine if a test was successful within its required value specifications.

seg-source.mrk: In the test orders, the determined actual values of a test are entered and, if available, compared with the predetermined required value.
The goal of the test order is to determine if a test was successful within its required value specifications.

trans-unit.source: Test Order Card

seg-source.mrk: Test Order Card

trans-unit.source: Test orders can be opened from the Test Orders list page where all test orders are listed or from the Test Order per Status menu which provides access to test orders by status.

seg-source.mrk: Test orders can be opened from the Test Orders list page where all test orders are listed or from the Test Order per Status menu which provides access to test orders by status.

trans-unit.source: : Accessing the test orders

seg-source.mrk: : Accessing the test orders

trans-unit.source: The structural composition of the Test Order is essentially the same as that of the Test Plan.

seg-source.mrk: The structural composition of the Test Order is essentially the same as that of the Test Plan.

trans-unit.source: : Test order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

seg-source.mrk: : Test order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

trans-unit.source: The compilation of test orders can occur in different ways. Test orders can be created according to specification from an arrival or by arrival of material from a production order. These test orders can be created manually or automatically (based on Test Plan Setup, refer to the table in topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Creation.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Creation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) and can be processed immediately. In the following sections, the fields are explained based on an automatically generated test order.

seg-source.mrk: The compilation of test orders can occur in different ways.
Test orders can be created according to specification from an arrival or by arrival of material from a production order.

These test orders can be created manually or automatically (based on Test Plan Setup, refer to the table in topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Creation.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Creation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) and can be processed immediately.
In the following sections, the fields are explained based on an automatically generated test order.

trans-unit.source: When creating a test order manually, the entry fields must be filled accordingly.

seg-source.mrk: When creating a test order manually, the entry fields must be filled accordingly.

trans-unit.source: General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: General FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier from the number series or manually entered if manual numbering is allowed.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Description of the test order.

seg-source.mrk: Description of the test order.

trans-unit.source: Test Destination Type

seg-source.mrk: Test Destination Type

trans-unit.source: Predetermined if the test order to be carried out is related to test device or to an item test.

seg-source.mrk: Predetermined if the test order to be carried out is related to test device or to an item test.

trans-unit.source: Test Destination No.

seg-source.mrk: Test Destination No.

trans-unit.source: Number that builds the basis for the test order, based on the value in the Test Destination Type field.

seg-source.mrk: Number that builds the basis for the test order, based on the value in the Test Destination Type field.

trans-unit.source: Test Destination Variant Code

seg-source.mrk: Test Destination Variant Code

trans-unit.source: Variant that applies to the item, based on the value in the Test Destination No. field.

seg-source.mrk: Variant that applies to the item, based on the value in the Test Destination No.
field.

trans-unit.source: Test Date

seg-source.mrk: Test Date

trans-unit.source: Date the test order is created. This date can be changed manually if the test is to be carried out at a later date.

seg-source.mrk: Date the test order is created.
This date can be changed manually if the test is to be carried out at a later date.

trans-unit.source: Document Type / External Document Path

seg-source.mrk: Document Type / External Document Path

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the Test Plan is within Microsoft Dynamics NAV (Integrated Document) or if the test is related to an External Document.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if the Test Plan is within Microsoft Dynamics NAV (Integrated Document) or if the test is related to an External Document.

trans-unit.source: For Test Plans with an External Document, a mapping (data link) can be entered in the External Document Path field to indicate where the document is stored.

seg-source.mrk: For Test Plans with an External Document, a mapping (data link) can be entered in the External Document Path field to indicate where the document is stored.

trans-unit.source: Vendor No.

seg-source.mrk: Vendor No.

trans-unit.source: Vendor number which builds the basis for the test order, if it is a Test Plan that has been generated upon arrival.

seg-source.mrk: Vendor number which builds the basis for the test order, if it is a Test Plan that has been generated upon arrival.

trans-unit.source: Quantity to Test

seg-source.mrk: Quantity to Test

trans-unit.source: The value in this field (= delivery quantity; is transferred from the recorded quantity in the arrivals) serves as a calculation basis for the calculation of the value in the Random Sample Quantity field.

seg-source.mrk: The value in this field (= delivery quantity; is transferred from the recorded quantity in the arrivals) serves as a calculation basis for the calculation of the value in the Random Sample Quantity field.

trans-unit.source: No. of Units

seg-source.mrk: No.
of Units

trans-unit.source: Delivered quantity of bins.

seg-source.mrk: Delivered quantity of bins.

trans-unit.source: Test Plan No. / Test Plan Version Code

seg-source.mrk: Test Plan No.
/ Test Plan Version Code

trans-unit.source: Automatically filled according to specification of the chosen Test Plan.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically filled according to specification of the chosen Test Plan.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Current processing state of the Test Order. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Current processing state of the Test Order.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Created – Set if no processing has occurred.

seg-source.mrk: Created – Set if no processing has occurred.

trans-unit.source: Value Recording – Set manually by clicking Release on the ribbon. Now it is possible to begin the test by entering the determined actual values. Erroneously entered determined values can be changed or tests can be cancelled while in this status.

seg-source.mrk: Value Recording – Set manually by clicking Release on the ribbon.
Now it is possible to begin the test by entering the determined actual values.
Erroneously entered determined values can be changed or tests can be cancelled while in this status.

trans-unit.source: Testing Finished – Set when all property sets have been processed.

seg-source.mrk: Testing Finished – Set when all property sets have been processed.

trans-unit.source: Finished – Set manually, by clicking Finish on the ribbon, when all property sets have been processed. No changes can be made with this status.

seg-source.mrk: Finished – Set manually, by clicking Finish on the ribbon, when all property sets have been processed.
No changes can be made with this status.

trans-unit.source: Cancelled – Set manually, by clicking Cancel on the ribbon, when a test order needs to be cancelled. This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant.

seg-source.mrk: Cancelled – Set manually, by clicking Cancel on the ribbon, when a test order needs to be cancelled.
This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to change the status of multiple test orders using the “Change Test Order Status” function, accessible from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Change Test Order Status.

seg-source.mrk: It is also possible to change the status of multiple test orders using the “Change Test Order Status” function, accessible from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Change Test Order Status.

trans-unit.source: Stability Test Status

seg-source.mrk: Stability Test Status

trans-unit.source: Current processing state of the Stability Test. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Current processing state of the Stability Test.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: In Process – Set automatically and used internally to prevent parallel processing.

seg-source.mrk: In Process – Set automatically and used internally to prevent parallel processing.

trans-unit.source: On Hold – Set when the order is created or after processing when further stability tests exist.

seg-source.mrk: On Hold – Set when the order is created or after processing when further stability tests exist.

trans-unit.source: Cancelled – Set manually, by clicking Cancel on the ribbon, when a test order needs to be cancelled. This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant. This function can cancel only the Test Order or the Test Order and the Stability Test (refer to topic “Cancel a Stability Test” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Cancelled – Set manually, by clicking Cancel on the ribbon, when a test order needs to be cancelled.
This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant.

This function can cancel only the Test Order or the Test Order and the Stability Test (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Cancel a Stability Test.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Cancel a Stability Test” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Finished – Set manually, by clicking Finish on the ribbon, when all property sets have been processed. No changes can be made with this status.

seg-source.mrk: Finished – Set manually, by clicking Finish on the ribbon, when all property sets have been processed.
No changes can be made with this status.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to change the status of multiple test orders using the “Change Test Order Status” function, accessible from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Change Test Order Status.

seg-source.mrk: It is also possible to change the status of multiple test orders using the “Change Test Order Status” function, accessible from the cc|quality management menu by clicking Tasks > Change Test Order Status.

seg-source.mrk: No.
Printed

seg-source.mrk: Automatically populated/updated each time the test order is printed.

of Units to Test

trans-unit.source: Random Sample Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Random Sample Quantity

trans-unit.source: Quantity of the random sample that is to be tested when running an attribute testing (faulty/not faulty parts). The basis for this calculation is the Quantity To Test field.

seg-source.mrk: Quantity of the random sample that is to be tested when running an attribute testing (faulty/not faulty parts).
The basis for this calculation is the Quantity To Test field.

trans-unit.source: Test result, calculated based on the test property values.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Source FastTab on Test Order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

trans-unit.source: Source Type

seg-source.mrk: Source Type

trans-unit.source: Origin of the test order, if generated from a purchase delivery, a sales document, a production order, a process step, a stability test, or a production order component.

seg-source.mrk: Origin of the test order, if generated from a purchase delivery, a sales document, a production order, a process step, a stability test, or a production order component.

trans-unit.source: Source Status

seg-source.mrk: Source Status

trans-unit.source: Status of the production order, if the Source Type field is set to Production Order.

seg-source.mrk: Status of the production order, if the Source Type field is set to Production Order.

seg-source.mrk: Source No.

trans-unit.source: Number of the source document.

/ Source Operation No.
/ Source Component Line No.

trans-unit.source: Routing, operation, or component line numbers from which the test order originated if the Source Type field is filtered on Production Order, Operation, or Component.

trans-unit.source: Order-specific

seg-source.mrk: Order-specific

trans-unit.source: If selected, the Test Order was created from a Sales Order with an Order-specific test plan.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the Test Order was created from a Sales Order with an Order-specific test plan.

trans-unit.source: Creation Date / Created by / Last Date Modified / Last Modified by

seg-source.mrk: Creation Date / Created by / Last Date Modified / Last Modified by

trans-unit.source: Test order creation and modification information. These values are automatically determined based on the current date and the active User ID and are non-editable.

seg-source.mrk: Test order creation and modification information.
These values are automatically determined based on the current date and the active User ID and are non-editable.

trans-unit.source: Lot No. / Serial No.

seg-source.mrk: Lot No.
/ Serial No.

trans-unit.source: Item tracking information to which the test order refers; populated based on the Item Test Order Option selection in the Test Order Setup for the item (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Plan Setup on Items.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Plan Setup on Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Item tracking information to which the test order refers; populated based on the Item Test Order Option selection in the Test Order Setup for the item (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Plan Setup on Items.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Plan Setup on Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Test Incident No. / Test Incident Order No.

seg-source.mrk: Test Incident No.
/ Test Incident Order No.

trans-unit.source: Used with Test Incidents (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Incidents.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Incidents” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Used with Test Incidents (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Incidents.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Incidents” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Miscellaneous FastTab

trans-unit.source: The Miscellaneous FastTab contains information about test types and repeat orders.

seg-source.mrk: The Miscellaneous FastTab contains information about test types and repeat orders.

trans-unit.source: : Miscellaneous FastTab on Test Order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

seg-source.mrk: : Miscellaneous FastTab on Test Order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

trans-unit.source: In the Test Type and Test No. fields, the test type that builds the basis for the test order is indicated by number. The values for these fields are transferred from the Test Status page, if they exist, on release of the Test Order. After completion of the test order, this page is filled by the appropriate newly determined value from the Inspection Severity page.

seg-source.mrk: In the Test Type and Test No.
fields, the test type that builds the basis for the test order is indicated by number.
The values for these fields are transferred from the Test Status page, if they exist, on release of the Test Order.
After completion of the test order, this page is filled by the appropriate newly determined value from the Inspection Severity page.

trans-unit.source: The Repeat No. and First Order No. fields indicate respective information as to the original test order, if the current test order is a repeat test order.

seg-source.mrk: The Repeat No.
and First Order No.
fields indicate respective information as to the original test order, if the current test order is a repeat test order.

trans-unit.source: Planning FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Planning FastTab

trans-unit.source: Test Orders can be scheduled and therefore, receive Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time. The fields on the Planning FastTab are used with the Test Order Scheduling function. If no activities are assigned to Test Order Properties, then no Ending Date-Time is calculated.

seg-source.mrk: Test Orders can be scheduled and therefore, receive Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time.
The fields on the Planning FastTab are used with the Test Order Scheduling function.
If no activities are assigned to Test Order Properties, then no Ending Date-Time is calculated.

trans-unit.source: : Planning FastTab on Test Order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

seg-source.mrk: : Planning FastTab on Test Order created automatically by posting purchase receipt for item Q-40014

trans-unit.source: The Starting Date / Time and Ending Date / Time are calculated based on the Source Type and the duration in the Test Order Activities. Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Date / Time and Ending Date / Time are calculated based on the Source Type and the duration in the Test Order Activities.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Navigate Tab

trans-unit.source: Several functions are available for the Test Order by clicking the Navigate tab.

seg-source.mrk: Several functions are available for the Test Order by clicking the Navigate tab.

seg-source.mrk: : Navigate tab actions

trans-unit.source: Each function is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Function

seg-source.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Test Order Property Sets

seg-source.mrk: Test Order Property Sets

trans-unit.source: Opens the Test Order Property Set page, which lists all property sets that are allocated to this test order.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Test Order Property Set page, which lists all property sets that are allocated to this test order.

trans-unit.source: Test Order Properties

seg-source.mrk: Test Order Properties

trans-unit.source: Opens the Test Order Properties page, which lists the values from the properties that were entered for the Test Property Set in the Lines FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Test Order Properties page, which lists the values from the properties that were entered for the Test Property Set in the Lines FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Internal Comments / External Comments

seg-source.mrk: Internal Comments / External Comments

trans-unit.source: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test order.

seg-source.mrk: Comments can be used to add notes and remarks about a test order.

trans-unit.source: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company.

seg-source.mrk: Internal comments are printed on documents that will not leave the company.

trans-unit.source: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

seg-source.mrk: External comments will appear on documents that can be sent to the customer or vendor.

trans-unit.source: Show External Document

seg-source.mrk: Show External Document

trans-unit.source: Opens the external document that was entered in the External Document Path field on the General FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the external document that was entered in the External Document Path field on the General FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Value Recording

seg-source.mrk: Value Recording

trans-unit.source: Opens the QM Value Recording page, which contains various pieces of information that refer to the respective property set. All property sets to be examined are displayed consecutively and the ascertained actual-value is entered. Use the buttons to have the property sets displayed or to be set to examine.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the QM Value Recording page, which contains various pieces of information that refer to the respective property set.
All property sets to be examined are displayed consecutively and the ascertained actual-value is entered.
Use the buttons to have the property sets displayed or to be set to examine.

trans-unit.source: Return Orders

seg-source.mrk: Return Orders

trans-unit.source: Opens the Return Orders that are created from the Test Order. This can be used if the Return Order is related to a Purchase Receipt.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Return Orders that are created from the Test Order.
This can be used if the Return Order is related to a Purchase Receipt.

trans-unit.source: Activities

seg-source.mrk: Activities

trans-unit.source: Opens the Test Order Activities page, which displays all activities related to this Test Order.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Test Order Activities page, which displays all activities related to this Test Order.

trans-unit.source: An activity listed on this page may refer to more than one Test Order Property. It defines the starting and ending of individual testing activities and includes a link to assigned Resource and Work Center. All listed activities are parallel operations and therefore, the longest Execution Time defines the Ending Date-Time of the entire Test Order.

seg-source.mrk: An activity listed on this page may refer to more than one Test Order Property.
It defines the starting and ending of individual testing activities and includes a link to assigned Resource and Work Center.
All listed activities are parallel operations and therefore, the longest Execution Time defines the Ending Date-Time of the entire Test Order.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Actions Tab

seg-source.mrk: Actions Tab

trans-unit.source: Several functions and reports are available for the Test Order by clicking the Actions tab.

seg-source.mrk: Several functions and reports are available for the Test Order by clicking the Actions tab.

trans-unit.source: : Actions tab actions

seg-source.mrk: : Actions tab actions

trans-unit.source: Each function/report is described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Each function/report is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Function / Report

seg-source.mrk: Function / Report

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Copy Test Plan

seg-source.mrk: Copy Test Plan

trans-unit.source: Copies a Test Plan which differs from the requirements in the master data for the examination of an item or test device, respectively. In doing so, the test types and property sets registered with the new Test Plan of the copied Test Plan are overwritten. The copying of a Test Plan is only possible when the Status field is set to Created.

seg-source.mrk: Copies a Test Plan which differs from the requirements in the master data for the examination of an item or test device, respectively.
In doing so, the test types and property sets registered with the new Test Plan of the copied Test Plan are overwritten.
The copying of a Test Plan is only possible when the Status field is set to Created.

trans-unit.source: Copy Test Order

seg-source.mrk: Copy Test Order

trans-unit.source: Copies test types and their allocated property sets from an existing test order into the current test order. This function is equipped with a safety scan in the occasion that existing test types and property set lines are entered with the current test order. The copying of one test order into another is only possible if the Status field of the destination order is set to Created.

seg-source.mrk: Copies test types and their allocated property sets from an existing test order into the current test order.
This function is equipped with a safety scan in the occasion that existing test types and property set lines are entered with the current test order.
The copying of one test order into another is only possible if the Status field of the destination order is set to Created.

trans-unit.source: Create Repeat Order

seg-source.mrk: Create Repeat Order

trans-unit.source: The pre-condition for creating a repeat order is that the Status field of the test order is set to Finished. When this function is run, a message appears that states the test number of the repeat order.

seg-source.mrk: The pre-condition for creating a repeat order is that the Status field of the test order is set to Finished.
When this function is run, a message appears that states the test number of the repeat order.

trans-unit.source: The repeat order is created with the Status field set to Created and can be processed. In the Miscellaneous FastTab, the number of the original (source) test order is displayed in the First Order No. field.

seg-source.mrk: The repeat order is created with the Status field set to Created and can be processed.
In the Miscellaneous FastTab, the number of the original (source) test order is displayed in the First Order No.
field.

trans-unit.source: Calc. Sample Size

seg-source.mrk: Calc.
Sample Size

trans-unit.source: Calculates the random sample quantity and assigns it in the Random Sample Quantity field if the test order Status field is set to Created.

seg-source.mrk: Calculates the random sample quantity and assigns it in the Random Sample Quantity field if the test order Status field is set to Created.

trans-unit.source: The basis for this calculation is the value in the Quantity to Test field. Based on this value, a key letter is determined in the Sample Size/Inspection Level page. The required sample size is allocated to this key letter in the Sample Instruction for Test Type page. The sample size will be transferred to the Random Sample Quantity field.

seg-source.mrk: The basis for this calculation is the value in the Quantity to Test field.
Based on this value, a key letter is determined in the Sample Size/Inspection Level page.
The required sample size is allocated to this key letter in the Sample Instruction for Test Type page.
The sample size will be transferred to the Random Sample Quantity field.

trans-unit.source: Release

seg-source.mrk: Release

trans-unit.source: Populates the Test Type and Test No. fields on the Miscellaneous FastTab, determines the current values from the Inspection Severity Plan, and populates the maximum accepted error quantity fields. It then changes the Status to Value Recording.

seg-source.mrk: Populates the Test Type and Test No.
fields on the Miscellaneous FastTab, determines the current values from the Inspection Severity Plan, and populates the maximum accepted error quantity fields.
It then changes the Status to Value Recording.

trans-unit.source: Cancel

seg-source.mrk: Cancel

trans-unit.source: Used when a test order needs to be cancelled. This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant. Changes the Status to Cancelled.

seg-source.mrk: Used when a test order needs to be cancelled.
This may be necessary, for example, if one determined value lies beyond the expected values and as a result all further values are irrelevant.
Changes the Status to Cancelled.

trans-unit.source: Finish

seg-source.mrk: Finish

trans-unit.source: Used when all test order processing has been completed. Changes the Status to Finished; no changes can be made with this status.

seg-source.mrk: Used when all test order processing has been completed.
Changes the Status to Finished; no changes can be made with this status.

trans-unit.source: Test Decision

seg-source.mrk: Test Decision

trans-unit.source: On a Finished test order, opens the Lot-/Serial No. Administration page, which is used to release or block a lot (refer to topic “Lot-/Serial No. Administration” on page 1 for more information).

seg-source.mrk: On a Finished test order, opens the <span class="Bold">Lot-/Serial No.
Administration page, which is used to release or block a lot (refer to topic “Lot-/Serial No. Administration” on page 1 for more information).

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: If a test order that has not been finished but exists for a lot, this lot cannot be released. It is merely possible to block the lot or conditionally release it for production.

seg-source.mrk: If a test order that has not been finished but exists for a lot, this lot cannot be released.
It is merely possible to block the lot or conditionally release it for production.

trans-unit.source: Reset Value Recording

seg-source.mrk: Reset Value Recording

trans-unit.source: Resets the Status of a test order from Value Recording back to Created.

seg-source.mrk: Resets the Status of a test order from Value Recording back to Created.

trans-unit.source: Create Return Order

seg-source.mrk: Create Return Order

trans-unit.source: Used to create a Purchase Return Order. This function is only available if the Test Order is related to a Purchase Receipt and the Inspection Result = Items are not OK.

seg-source.mrk: Used to create a Purchase Return Order.
This function is only available if the Test Order is related to a Purchase Receipt and the Inspection Result = Items are not OK.

trans-unit.source: Compare Test Result

seg-source.mrk: Compare Test Result

trans-unit.source: Used if the item has vendor-related Test Plans, the Test Order Status = Testing Finished or Finished, and the Inspection Result = Items are not OK. The results are compared to the Sales Order Test Plans that are related to a single customer number.

seg-source.mrk: Used if the item has vendor-related Test Plans, the Test Order Status = Testing Finished or Finished, and the Inspection Result = Items are not OK.
The results are compared to the Sales Order Test Plans that are related to a single customer number.

trans-unit.source: Reset Inspection Result

seg-source.mrk: Reset Inspection Result

trans-unit.source: Used to reset the value to Unspecified in the Inspection Result field (refer to topic “Unspecified Inspection Result on Test Order” on page 1). This function can only be run by an authorized user.

seg-source.mrk: Used to reset the value to Unspecified in the Inspection Result field (refer to topic “Unspecified Inspection Result on Test Order” on page 1).
This function can only be run by an authorized user.

trans-unit.source: Test Order

seg-source.mrk: Test Order

trans-unit.source: Generates the Test Order report for preview or printing; typically an internal document.

seg-source.mrk: Generates the Test Order report for preview or printing; typically an internal document.

trans-unit.source: Analysis Certificate

seg-source.mrk: Analysis Certificate

trans-unit.source: Generates the Analysis Certificate report for preview or printing, which displays the test results of a test order. It is an external document that is provided to the customer.

seg-source.mrk: Generates the Analysis Certificate report for preview or printing, which displays the test results of a test order.
It is an external document that is provided to the customer.

trans-unit.source: Sample Spare Label

seg-source.mrk: Sample Spare Label

trans-unit.source: Generates a Spare Label for a sample (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Sample Planning.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Sample Planning” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Generates a Spare Label for a sample (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Sample Planning.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Sample Planning” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).
